page.title: 17THE HISTORY OF MORETON SCH.
page.content: In our square there is a school in Moreton which was used up until July 1968.In that year it was closed,along with Yarpole and Croft V.A. school and the children were transferred to the new school in Luston.Before{ Moreton {School}was built there was a school called the{Lady Rodney{School.}This was knocked down and Moreton School was built and opened in 1905 and was owned by{Lord Cawley}of Berrington Hall.The average number of pupils was between 60 and 70.When the school closed in 1968 the old stove was taken to{Eye Church}in the next village and the school was sold to the present owners who are Mr and Mrs Williams.It cost Â£2,000 to buy and another Â£2,500 to renovate.There has been a lot of internal alteration but the only external alteration has been the fitting of smaller windows.
